content.body:
Probably not, but just in caseâ€¦
Is there a way for ecmarkup to become aware of definitions from Ecma262 pull requests? I want a proposal spec to refer to the Decorator productions from #2417â€”and I want to suppress the grammar-shape errors resulting from the spec referring to those productions.

content.body: jschoi: check out the pr, run `ecmarkup --verbose --write-biblio whatever.json spec.html > /dev/null`; this will produce a `whatever.json` biblio file. in your proposal, do `ecmarkup --load-biblio ./whatever.json your-proposal.html`.

content.body:
yes, I mean how default is treated different here:

`import x from "path"`
And 
`const x = v`;

when 

`import {x} from "path"`
and
`const {x} = v;`
content.formatted_body:
yes, I mean how default is treated different here:

import x from "path"
And
const x = v;

when

import {x} from "path"
and
const {x} = v;

content.body: This was also discussed via https://github.com/tc39/notes/blob/main/meetings/2016-11/nov-29.md#12iid-proposal-to-reform-the-spec-to-include-default-export-in-export--from-module around creating an aliasing pattern (since redirects have instancing issues)

content.body: I tripped up on this when trying to create a monorepo build tool using ES modules as redirects for inter-package links. It was annoying that those link modules could not be stable, and instead needed to be regenerated based on the target's content.
yeah, I generally feel like `export *` is only useful for glue code, and the glue code should not need to be updated when the thing it's re-exporting is updated; that's the whole point of it
content.formatted_body: yeah, I generally feel like export * is only useful for glue code, and the glue code should not need to be updated when the thing it's re-exporting is updated; that's the whole point of it

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: yeah, I generally feel like `export *` is only useful for glue code, and the glue code should not need to be updated when the thing it's re-exporting is updated; that's the whole point of it
